summary: Email chain from July 22, 2019, discussing concerns raised by Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys regarding his conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. The attorneys request better bathroom access during legal visits, promised phone calls, and the ability to eat lunch in the attorney conference room.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein's attorneys raised formal complaints about his conditions at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in July 2019, shortly before his death.

Specific complaints included restricted bathroom access during legal visits despite a prior promise, unfulfilled promises of 2 phone calls, and inability to eat proper meals during all-day legal meetings.
The email chain shows communication between Epstein's defense team and Bureau of Prisons staff regarding inmate treatment and procedural issues.
Epstein was reportedly eating only snacks from vending machines for several days because he couldn't leave attorney conferences for meals without losing visitation time.
